clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Needs Assessment and Efficiency of Smart Communication System for Patients With ALS (Part 1)

brief_summary.textblock: The research is aimed to explore the needs of clinical patients and their caregiver,so as to provide suggestions to the designer of the communication system.

detailed_description.textblock: To promote and develop a smart communication system is helpful to patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS),especially for stage 3 and stage 4 (late stage). Through the needs assessment, the research is aimed to explore the needs of clinical patients and their caregiver,so as to provide suggestions to the designer of the communication system.

primary_outcome.measure: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Supportive Care Needs (ALSSCN)
primary_outcome.description: The ALSSCN consisted of 37 items with seven domains: physical, psychological, emotional, spiritual, social, informational, and practical needs.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with ALS were recruited from ALS clinics(Taipei Veterans General Hospital, Taiwan, R.O.C),20 participants. Participants were eligible for this study if they were diagnosed with definite, probable, probable laboratory-supported, or possible ALS according to the criteria (Brooks et al., 2000).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of ALS
- Taiwanese and used traditional Chinese(Mandarin).
- If they were older than age 20 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Frontotemporal dementia, severe depression, or schizophrenia.
- If they cannot complete the questionnaire with researchers or family members help.

clinical_study.keyword: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, ALS, communication, needs
